feed.title: NewsTracker: snowden
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: CIA tried to hack Apple devices for nearly a decade, claim Edward Snowden papers
entry.summary: This is according to investigative news site, The Intercept, who today cited documents obtained from NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden.

entry.title: Snowden: CIA tried to hack Apple devices for nearly a decade
entry.summary: Both companies said the moves were aimed at protecting the privacy of users of their products and that this was partly a response to wide scale U.S. government spying on Internet users revealed by Snowden in the summer of 2013.

entry.title: John Oliver interviewsï¿½Edward Snowden, and real journalism breaks out
Oliver Stone's 'Snowden' filming at locations around DC
entry.summary: Film crews have been spotted near the White House and in the Tryst coffee shop in Adams Morgan that Snowden frequented.

entry.title: Artists to NYPD: Return Edward Snowden Bust We Put in Park
entry.summary: The mysterious artists who planted a bust of Edward Snowden on a Revolutionary War monument now want to free their sculpture from police custody and display it again, saying it was intended as a thought-provoking "gift to the city."

entry.title: Artists to NYPD: Return Edward Snowden bust we put in park
entry.summary: Parks activist Geoffrey Croft feels the bust deserves a place in the city's public space, regardless how viewers may feel about Snowden.

entry.title: Artists to NYPD: Return Edward Snowden bust we put in park
entry.summary: For now, downtown Manhattan gallery Postmasters hopes to show the Snowden bust next month.

entry.title: Artists to NYPD: Return Edward Snowden bust we put on park's Revolutionary War monument
entry.summary: NEW YORK - The mysterious artists who planted a bust of Edward Snowden on a Revolutionary War monument in a New York City park want the sculpture back.

entry.title: Artists to NYPD: Return Edward Snowden bust we put in park
First look at Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Shailene Woodley filming Oliver Stone's Snowden in Washington, D.C.
entry.summary: First look at Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Shailene Woodley filming Oliver Stone's Snowden in Washington, D.C.

entry.title: Busted! Guerrilla artists sneak giant sculpture of Edward Snowden's head into Brooklyn park only to have it pulled down hours later by city workers
entry.summary: 'If you look at history, the people we honor with statues now - certainly the people rebelling against the British rules - were criminals one day,' the creators of the Snowden bust told Mashable.

entry.title: Statue that cast Edward Snowden as a hero removed and held by New York police
entry.summary:
New York City Parks workers work to remove a covered large molded bust of Edward Snowden at Fort Greene Park in Brooklyn.

But two of the artists behind the sculpture, who spoke to Fairfax Media on condition of anonymity, hope that its presence, however fleeting, will help spark conversation about Snowden, surveillance and the American ideals they say he was fighting for.

entry.title: Bust of Edward Snowden sneaked into, removed from NYC park
entry.summary:
After several mysterious artists put a sculpted bust of Snowden on a New York City war memorial, parks officials have ordered the bust removed.

Animal New York, a city news website, reported that the activists sneaked the 4-foot-tall, 100-pound bust of Snowden before dawn Monday.

entry.title: Bust of whistleblower Edward Snowden sneaked into New York City park; its display short-lived
entry.summary: Snowden's artistic appearance was short-lived.

entry.title: Bust of Edward Snowden sneaked into, removed from NYC park
entry.summary: At daybreak, police said city parks officials ordered the sculpted Snowden removed.

entry.title: Bust of Edward Snowden Sneaked Into, Removed From NYC Park
entry.summary: Suddenly, in the middle of the New York night, Edward Snowden's face appeared - deep in a public park.

entry.title: Huge, illicit bust of Snowden erected in New York
entry.summary: The name "Snowden" spelled out in bronze letters appeared to be attached to an adjacent shorter pedestal on top of which sits a bronze bald eagle spreading its wings, a statue that has long made its home in the park.

entry.title: Artists Snuck a Giant Bust of Edward Snowden on Top of a Brooklyn War Monument
entry.summary: It would be a dishonor to those memorialized here to not laud those who protect the ideals they fought for, as Edward Snowden has by bringing the NSA's 4th-Amendment-violating surveillance programs to light.

entry.title: John Oliver, Edward Snowden have a Frost/Nixon moment
entry.summary:
The comedian asked Snowden if he had read every document he leaked and fired back when Snowden replied that he understands what he turned over.

He also confronted Snowden about the New York Times publishing information he provided that may have compromised an operation in Iraq.

Oliver eventually moved on to somewhat lighter fare, showing man-on-the street reactions by Americans who don't know who Snowden is and reacting to the news that the NSA is able to collect some of the naked selfies Americans send each other in a database.

entry.title: John Oliver interviews Edward Snowden, and real journalism breaks out
entry.summary: Oliver pushed hard against Snowden, whom he described as "the most famous hero and/or traitor in recent American history," with a particular focus on Snowden's decision to leak unredacted documents.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Teaches John Oliver How the Government Can Get Your ?Di*k Pic? (Video)
entry.summary: "The good news is that there's no program named the 'dick pic' program. The bad news& they are still collecting everybody's information, including your dick pics," Snowden giggled.

entry.title: John Oliver grills Edward Snowden
entry.summary: "You will never be completely free from risk if you if you're free. The only time you can be free from risk are if you're in prison," Snowden said.

entry.title: John Oliver grills Edward Snowden
entry.summary: "I've evaluated all of the documents that are in the archive," Snowden replied.

entry.title: Watch: John Oliver discusses NSA, penis pics with Edward Snowden on 'Last Week Tonight'
entry.summary:
Then Oliver revealed his coup to a delighted audience -- a secretive one-on-one interview with Snowden in Russia, which seemed as if it might not come to pass after Snowden was late to their meeting.

Thankfully, Snowden finally arrived and the duo shared a frank, funny and wide-ranging discussion about everything from NSA programs to the leak of phallic photos.

entry.title: WATCH: John Oliver grills Edward Snowden on 'Last Week Tonight'
entry.summary: John Oliver and Edward Snowden.

entry.title: Britain spied on Argentina over Falklands: Snowden
ACLU: Snowden proved NSA Internet spying harms Americans
ACLU: Snowden proved NSA Internet spying harms Americans
entry.summary:
Wikipedia was included on an NSA slide Snowden leaked in 2013 that demonstrated the agency's interest in monitoring communications on certain websites.

Mark Rumold, an attorney for the Electronic Frontier Foundation, said Snowden's disclosures could certainly bolster ACLU's argument, but the state secret privilege remains a challenge.

entry.title: CIA worked to break into Apple devices for years ? Snowden docs
Snowden: Asylum In Switzerland A 'Great Political Option'
entry.summary: Edward Snowden wants Switzerland to grant him asylum.

entry.title: New Zealand spying on South Pacific neighbors, Snowden documents show
New Zealand shared spy data on Pacific states with allies, Snowden documents allege
entry.summary: The role of the agency, which has a large eavesdropping facility at the top of the country's South Island, was an issue in last year's general election, with documents released by Snowden suggesting the GCSB was planning to conduct mass domestic surveillance.

entry.title: News24.com | Snowden in talks on returning home - lawyer
entry.summary: Kucherena said last August Snowden had been granted a three-year residence permit in Russia.

entry.title: Joseph Gordon-Levitt shares first photo as Edward Snowden
NSA leaker Edward Snowden wants to return home, his lawyer says
entry.summary: Snowden was stranded in a Moscow airport in 2013 on his way from Hong Kong to Cuba, shortly after he released extensive documentation about the National Security Agency's surveillance programs.

entry.title: Lawyer: NSA leaker Edward Snowden wants to return home
entry.summary:
Snowden's Russian lawyer, Anatoly Kucherena, said Tuesday March 3, 2015 he was eager to return to the U.S. if given security guarantees, and German and U.S. lawyers were working on the issue.

MOSCOW (AP) - NSA systems analyst Edward Snowden wants to return to the United States from Russia if he's guaranteed a fair trial, his Russian lawyer said Tuesday.

entry.title: Lawyer: NSA leaker Edward Snowden wants to return home
Edward Snowden's lawyer is working with the United States on his return home
entry.summary: A Russian lawyer for Snowden said on Tuesday the fugitive former U.S. spy agency contractor who leaked details of the government's mass surveillance programs was working with American and German lawyers to return home.

entry.title: Fugitive ex-U.S. spy Snowden in talks on returning home: Lawyer
entry.summary: The U.S. position is that "Snowden is not a whistleblower. He is accused of leaking classified information and there is no question his actions have inflicted serious harms on our national security," Raimondi said.

entry.title: Fugitive ex-U.S. spy Snowden in talks on returning home: Lawyer
entry.summary:
Snowden's lawyer, Anatoly Kucherena, who has links to the Kremlin, was speaking at a news conference to present a book he has written about his client.

Moscow granted Snowden asylum in 2013, straining already tense ties with Washington.

The United States wants Snowden to stand trial for leaking extensive secrets of electronic surveillance programmes by the National Security Agency (NSA).

U.S. Justice Department spokesman Marc Raimondi told Reuters: "It remains our position that Mr. Snowden should return to the United States and face the charges filed against him. If he does, he will be accorded full due process and protections."

entry.title: Snowden in talks on returning to U.S., Russian lawyer says
entry.summary:
Snowden has said in the past he would like to return home if he was assured he would be given a fair trial.

A deeply divisive figure, Snowden is praised by some as a civil rights campaigner and whistleblower and condemned by others as a traitor who had compromised U.S. security.

entry.title: Snowden leak: NSA helped British steal cell phone codes
entry.summary: Still, the methods in this case may prove controversial, as did earlier Snowden revelations that the NSA was hacking transmissions among Google's data centers.
